Package org.example.lab.agh

Class Reader

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Thread
org.example.lab.agh.Reader
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class Reader extends Thread
The Reader class represents a reader thread in the library simulation. Readers attempt to access the library for reading, following synchronization constraints defined by semaphores and shared state in the Library. Each reader is identified by a unique ID and interacts with the library to manage its access and state transitions.

  • Constructor Details

    • Reader

      public Reader(Integer idk, Semaphore mut, Semaphore wri, Semaphore que, Library librar)
      Constructs a new Reader instance with the given ID and semaphores.
      Parameters:
      idk - the unique ID of the reader
      mut - the semaphore for synchronizing access to shared variables
      wri - the semaphore for controlling writer access to the library
      que - , the semaphore for queue management
      librar - the shared Library instance

  • Method Details

    • run

      public void run()
      The main execution method of the reader thread. Readers repeatedly:
      • Add themselves to the waiting list of readers.
      • Attempt to acquire access to the library through semaphores.
      • Read for a specified duration.
      • Release access and wait before the next reading attempt.
      Synchronization is achieved through semaphores and interaction with the Library.
      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable
      Overrides:
      run in class Thread
